The term 'criminal gang' is defined as an ongoing group of 5 or more persons whose primary purpose is to commit criminal offenses, or has been designated as such by the Secretary of Homeland Security. The offenses described in this subparagraph include felony drug offenses, offenses related to harboring certain aliens, aiding certain aliens to enter the US, importation of aliens for immoral purposes, crimes of violence, and crimes involving obstruction of justice. The offenses described in this subparagraph include obstruction of justice, tampering with witnesses, fraud, peonage, slavery, trafficking in persons, racketeering, money laundering, and engaging in monetary transactions.
